About Me

Originally from France, I’m now based in London where I work in the web industry. On each of my projects, I’m on a quest to find a balance between appealing design, maintainable code and optimal web performance. Download my CV

Timeline

  1. 1990

    Got an Amiga 500 and took my first programming steps in BASIC

  2. 2002

    Graduated in Computing Science at IUT de Metz (Metz, France)

  3. 2005

    Erasmus studies (Jaen, Spain)

    Graduated in Language Studies (Metz, France)

  4. 2006

    Writer, Assistant Editor then Head of Training at Chambers & Partners (London, UK)

  5. 2011

    Achieved a distinction in MA Digital Media at London Metropolitan University (London, UK)

  6. 2012

    Changed careers and became a Web Designer at S2Media (Brussels, Belgium)

  7. 2013

    Web Developer at Virtual Universe (London, UK)

  8. 2015

    Head of UX & Front-End Development at The Culture Trip (London, UK)

  9. 2016

    Senior Web Developer at Virtual Universe (London, UK)

Portfolio

Check out some examples of my most recent work. I’ve also worked with several global brands including L'Oréal, Lindt, Kipling, and Thompson.

  • Trendstop

    I'm currently a Senior Web Developer for Trendstop, where I mainly focus on front-end development. While my role is to work with designers to implement new designs and functionalities, I have become more involved in optimising web pages to improve performance. Being a player in the fashion industry, Trendstop relies on heavy use of high-definition images, which is a challenge in terms of performance. I have worked on regular dynamic pages, web applications, as well as functionalities for administrators.

    Technology: JavaScript, jQuery, AJAX, PHP, CSS, SASS, Gulp, Webpack

    • Creation of web applications, such as Trendstop Stories

    • Asynchronous and gradual loading of high-definition images

    • Mobile-friendly responsive layout

  • The Culture Trip

    I joined startup, The Culture Trip in its early days. They needed someone to look after their website to please their fast-increasing number of visitors, and to smooth the editorial process. As the Head of UX & Front-End Development, I was in charge of revamping the whole website, migrating 10,000+ articles from an XML-based CMS to a Wordpress database, as well as creating several tools to improve the editorial production workflow.

    Technology: PHP, JavaScript, jQuery, AJAX, AngularJS, CSS

    • Creation of custom Wordpress plugins to improve editorial workflow

    • Complete redesign of the website

    • Migration and restructuring of 10K+ articles
